DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: Fluorouracil is a type of chemotherapy called an antimetabolite, which is a drug that mimics a natural chemical and prevents its use in cells. It interferes with the production of a key component of DNA, which prevents the DNA from copying itself. This causes cancer cells and other rapidly dividing cells to die. Fluorouracil also gets incorporated into RNA and DNA, disrupting critical cell functions.

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Fluorouracil injection is approved to treat:
Fluorouracil is also called 5-FU. Fluorouracil is also being studied in the treatment of other conditions and types of cancer.
Fluorouracil is also available in a topical form. For more information, see the Drug Information Summary for Fluorouracil (Topical).
